thread.title: Suspect In Custody After Police Officer Assaulted In NE Philadelphia
thread.title_full: Suspect In Custody After Police Officer Assaulted In NE Philadelphia

author: CBS Philly
title: Suspect In Custody After Police Officer Assaulted In NE Philadelphia
text:
Suspect In Custody After Police Officer Assaulted In NE Philadelphia March 20, 2017 6:26 AM By Trang Do Filed Under: assault , Northeast Philadelphia , Philadelphia Police 
PHILADELPHIA (CBS) — A Philadelphia Police officer was hospitalized after he was assaulted earlier this morning in Northeast Philadelphia. 
Police say his attacker, who may have also robbed a convenience store in the neighborhood yesterday, is in custody. 
Authorities say the officer was treated and released from Aria Torresdale Hospital after suffering an injury to his head. 
Eyewitness News is told he works in the 8th District and is a 20 year veteran of the force. 
Police say the suspect arrested is just 17 years old. 
The incident began around 4 a.m. Monday after police received a call about a man with a gun in the Parkwood shopping center on the 12000 block of Academy Road. 
An officer stopped the suspect and attempted to frisk him when a struggle ensued. Police say the teen then body slammed the officer to the ground, causing him to hit his head. 
Employees at the Philly Pretzel Factory say police found the teenager hiding in the alley behind their store. 
John Gallante says,”Thank God the back door was locked. We didn’t hear anything unusual. We were good. He was right there.” 
Police say the teen also fits the description of a suspect who robbed a 7-Eleven at gunpoint early Sunday morning. 
Chief Inspector Scott Small says, “Not only is this individual going to be charged with assault on police, but Northeast is looking in to the possibility he may have committed this robbery at point of gun.” 
Small adds, “He has braces on his teeth. That’s the individual we have in custody today and that is also the description of the individual who committed the robbery point of gun, at the 7-Eleven.” 
Police and K9s are now combing the area looking for the weapon. Trang Do facebook Follow Trang Do came home to join the Eyewitness News team as a general assignment reporter in March of 2016.
